column4: I'm planning to install Windows XP and Windows 7 on a second hard drive. One problem is, my system clock is set to UTC. Has the bug with Windows failing to understand UTC been fixed, or must I change the system clock to local time?
I think windows still is weird about the clock.. I've set my clock to autoupdate in both windows and ubuntu.. that usually takes care of it
I'm leaning towards telling Windows to treat UTC as local time, if I can. Linux is the primary operating system on this machine.
